title: Blackberry Priv: let’s welcome the first Blackberry with Android; a 5.4-inch Quad HD flagship
text:
News from: Eza Ezamie Page views: 12 times Blackberry has finally succumbed to pressure and is set to release the Priv. Even staunch supporters of Blackberry may cross over to become Android users Current Android users will love what is in store for them with this amazing flagship. - Advertisement - 
Priv will have the authentic BlackBerry keyboard, legendary security, streamlined communications and productivity, combined with the wide world of Google Play store apps. It has been engineered with the world’s finest technology and packaged in an ultra-thin, ergonomically perfect device with a keyboard hidden by SmartSlide technology. 
In short, it is the Blackberry we know – but being boosted with the presence of Android at the back-end. The result is, something like taking a first class flight, but the simplicity and ease of use make it available for just about everyone. 
With the Priv expected to be available in November 2015, it is set to have a body of 147 x 77.2 x 9.4 mm (5.79 x 3.04 x 0.37 in) and weighs 192 g (6.77 oz). Although not the thinnest nor the lightest, let’s not forget that it will be featuring a full-featured QWERTY keyboard that slides right out. 
The Priv will then be sporting a 5.4-inch Quad HD AMOLED capacitive touchscreen that display is an amazing 1440 x 2560 pixels or ~540 ppi pixel density. It also has a curved edge screen that adds to its premium look and feel. 
Under the hood of the Priv will be the Qualcomm MSM8992 Snapdragon 808 chipset, a Hexa-core processor comprising Dual-core 1.8 GHz Cortex-A57 & Quad-core 1.44 GHz Cortex-A53 processor, Adreno 418 graphics and 3GB RAM. This makes for such a beast that can easily take on all apps and games that are out there in the market quite easily. - Advertisement - 
On the camera side of things, be prepared to be mesmerized by its 18 Megapixel primary camera that is powered by Schneider-Kreuznach optics, and will be featuring optical image stabilization, autofocus, dual-LED (dual tone) flash, geo-tagging, touch focus, face detection, HDR, and panorama. This will ensure you get the best possible out of a camera smartphone. On top of that, there’s also the 2 Megapixel secondary camera for your selfies and video calls should you require. 
It is also good to know that the Priv will have 32GB of internal storage and is further complemented by the fact that it can be further expanded up to a maximum of 200GB via its microSD slot. 
Once it is released, it will be accompanied by Android Lollipop 5.1. At this moment, we are not sure of whether it will get an update to the latest Marshmallow 6.0; just hang on there for a little longer. 
It is also good to know that the Priv will be powered by a Li-Ion 3410 mAh battery that should be enough to power up the device for at least a day or two in between charging. - Advertisement - 
So what can we make out of the new Blackberry Priv? Being the first Blackberry smartphone being powered by Android, is a huge jump by the people at RIM/Blackberry. It is a known fact that times are uncertain at Blackberry, and in times like these; sacrifices are necessary, and change seems to be the right move. We all know how they have struggled for a long time in the past, and their luck might just change with the introduction of this smartphone. Pure class security as expected from a Blackberry device and a QWERTY keyboard, coupled with the excellent Quad HD screen, amazing hardware, and a much more amazing camera – this could well be make or break time for Blackberry. 
The Blackberry Priv is expected to be available in November 2015 for approximately $579 Euro or ~$659 USD and will be available in only black color. News From
